abstract: JPMorgan Chase said on Wednesday that it was halting 56,000 foreclosures in 23 states because some of its employees might have improperly prepared the necessary documents.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase said on Wednesday that it was halting 56,000 foreclosures in 23 states because some of its employees might have improperly prepared the necessary documents.
lead_paragraph: In a sign that the entire foreclosure process is coming under pressure, a second major mortgage lender said that it was suspending court cases against defaulting homeowners so it could review its legal procedures, David Streitfeld writes in The New York Times.
